Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions Committee

item.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Health, Education, Labor, and Pensions. (text of measure as introduced: CR S8737-8738)
Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR S8735-8736)

summary.text: Federal Pell Grant Eligibility Clarification Act of 2003 - Amends the Higher Education Act of 1965 to revise eligibility requirements for certain Pell Grant awards by modifying the formula for determining total income to include consideration of current year circumstances for students residing in States in extended benefit periods under the Temporary Extended Unemployment Compensation Act of 2002.

bill.title: Federal Pell Grant Eligibility Clarification Act of 2003

item.title: Federal Pell Grant Eligibility Clarification Act of 2003
A bill to amend the Higher education Act of 1965 to modify the computation of eligibility for certain Federal Pell Grants, and for other purposes.
Federal Pell Grant Eligibility Clarification Act of 2003

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
